testimony: Mr Chairman this is the application of Thulani Mzokhona Myeza.
Mr Chairman my surname is Alberts: Nel, Coetzer, van Dyk in Durban.   I will be appearing on behalf of the applicant.
What are your initials Mr Alberts?
Mr Chairman just before he does so I may indicate that Mrs Zikhali is here. That is the widow of one of the deceased and I am informed that she opposes the application.
Well when the time comes you will put forward her views to us.
Mr Myeza tell us where were you born?
Can you tell us something about your family, do you have brothers and sisters.
Tell us something about your family, do you have brothers and sisters?
I have a mother, two brothers and two sisters.  My brothers are Nicholas and Vincent.  My sisters are Noxolo and Jabu.  I am the eldest.
I see you also mention a brother Mbeki Myeza who died in 1996, how did he die?
I was in detention when he died.  I do not know how, but I was told that he was sick.
Tell us how did you get involved with the IFP?
There was violence in Eshowe between the IFP and the ANC.  I then got into contact with the IFP leader in the location, Mr Dlulane.  At that time, I ...[intervention]
Can you just give us the name of this person again, Mr who?
Mr Dlulane Nyawuza.  He is the driver of uMntwana Gideon.
Why did you get in touch with him?
We planned that we had to attack the ANC  supporters who intended to disrupt the election in the location Eshowe.  We then agreed to do that.
You talked about doing what to ANC members?
We had to shoot them because they were also shooting the IFP members.
Sorry I didn't get the interpreter.  You talked about doing what to the ANC members?

We started attacking them.  Mr Nyawuza would drive me in his Mazda, and leave me at a certain place, where I would shoot people.  I was with another boys from Enseleni, namely Vusi Myeza and Phazimani ...[intervention]
When we arrived at Nyanini, we destroyed there because they had killed Mbeshe Mahaye.  He was killed near the bottle store.
Mr Myeza I just want to take you back to your joining of the IFP.
I joined the IFP when we were paying for the cards.  That was long ago.  In the beginning of the 90's we were given another card written Inkatha Freedom Party.
What was your reason for initially joining the IFP?
I joined the IFP because the people in the area where I was living belonged to the same party.
When you grew up did you grow up in the traditional Zulu way or did you grow up in a western style?
Did you also comply with the Zulu customs for example slaughtering animals and having the traditional ceremonies?
The first incident that you apply for amnesty for is the killing of Mr Zikhali. Can you give us the detail of how that happened?
Yes.  Mr Dlulane who was the leader of the IFP in the location took us to the Security Branch policeman, Thusi's house.  I was with Vusi Myeza ...[intervention]

I think that rather that we have a sequential account, so if possible put your questions in such a way that you go step by step. I have an idea we are getting a somewhat disjointed explanation.  Let's just talk about when was the decision taken to attack Zikhali, who took that decision, how was it taken, and then proceed as to precisely what was done. Very well.
The decision to kill Mr Zikhali was taken when we had a meeting.  We had to plan how we were going to shoot him because he was eluding us.  We had been looking for him for some time.

Just hold on. I want you to understand that what you are saying has to be translated to us in English so you have to talk in such a way that you give the translator time to translate what you are saying. Do you understand?
And I think that the translator, she finds or he finds that his evidence is being given too fast he or she should remind the speaker to slow down.
Mr Myeza when you had this meeting ...(intervention)
He said: "We took a decision to kill him."  I think that you should ask him now who is we.

Indeed Mr Chairman that is exactly my question now.
	When you took this decision who was at that meeting?
Mr Nyawuza was chairing the meeting.  The people who were present were Vusi Myeza, Sbu Zuma and myself.
And who was the person leading this meeting?
And what was decided at this meeting?
Just before you get to the decision, who were these people, who was Dlulane?
Who is this Mr Nyawuza Dlulane?

He is the driver of uMntwana Gideon.  He was the leader of the IFP in Gezinsila location.  I reported to him when I came to the location and the IFP members whose houses had been burnt were accommodated by him in his scrap yard.  He was also providing them with food.
Zuma was just an IFP member.  He was staying at Mandini.
Very well take it from there.

Thank you Mr Chairman.
	Why was the decision taken that Mr Zikhali had to die, what was the reason for that?

Mr Zikhali was the ANC member.  People from Nyanini who were ANC members could no longer enter the location at that time, but Mr Zikhali used to drive his car, fetch the people from Nyanini and bring them in the location.
And when he came into your area what did he do?
After bringing these boys in the location, IFP members would than be killed.
Just explain this to me, because the deceased would come into your area which is an IFP area people would die. What does that mean, how would people die just because a man came there?

Mr Zikhali was not the one who was doing the shooting.  This was done by the people he brought in the location from Nyanini.  At 10 pm, Mr Zikhali used to go fetch the Kentucky/Chicken Licken staff members from their place of the employment in town.  He would then visit his girlfriend who stayed at Ntuli cottages.
And did you have information stating that or is it just a suspicion that you had?
Or did you see that happen?
This was not just a suspicion.  He used to bring people in the location.
Did you see that happen or did you get information from somewhere else?
I once saw him doing it.
Okay and what was the decision taken at ...(intervention)
Sorry just before you. What did you see happening, him bringing people into the area or killing people in the area?

On the first day, on Saturday, a Ndlovu boy was shot and killed in the scrap yard.  This happened after Zikhali has brought the ANC boys, like Schoolboy, in the location.  The Eshowe police came there and instead of making arrests, they just continued shooting.  Mr Zikhali thereafter drove off and left the scene.  Nobody was arrested there.  This happened during the day.
Regarding the killing of this boy ...(intervention)
Were you there, did you see this?
Yes, I was present.  I saw it happening.
Just stop there.  When this man came into the area with other people was there a fight between his people and the people in the area?
And was it as a result of that fight that this Ndlovu boy died?
Yes, he died during that fight.
Were there other people that were involved in that fight?
You have to have two groups of people if there has to be a fight isn't it?
It was the IFP and ANC members fighting.
Yes and were you part of the IFP that took part in the fight on that day when Ndlovu died?

These boys were brought on that day and they alighted near Mr Nyawuza's scrap yard.  I was from the shop on that day and I saw this car driving past.  These boys were ten.  They walked toward the scrap yard and I then heard gunshots being fired by these boys who alighted from Zikhali's car.  Zikhali then drove off.  This IFP boy was left there.  The police arrived and intervened.  One of the ANC boys died at the scene was found by the heard boy the following day.
So you were not involved in that fight?
No, I was not personally involved on that day because I did not have a firearm.
Alright, now it as a result of this fight that Ndlovu boy died that you people took a decision about Zikhali?

Sorry Mr Alberts.
	Could I just take you back.  What time of day did this happen on that Saturday?
It was during the day, in full view of the public.
And you said that the body was discovered only the next day, is that correct?
Did you run away yourself when you heard the shots?
Did you see the shooting or did you just hear the shots?
I saw where the firing was taking place.  Not that I heard.  I ran away after Ntokozo Ndlovu of the IFP was shot.
You can't run away because the Ndlovu boy died because you did not know the Ndlovu boy, his body was only discovered the following day.

No, I did not say the body of Ndlovu was found the following day, I said the body of one of the ANC boys, who was shot when the police arrived there, was found the following day.  Ndlovu boy's body was taken by the police on the same day he was shot.
Just to get this clear, did you see the body of the Ndlovu boy on that same day?
Was that only after you went back to see what has happened after the shooting had ended?
When I came back after the police have arrived, it was after all the shooting had ceased.  I then saw the police removing the body of this Ndlovu boy.
Was it because of the shooting that you initially ran away?
Yes, I ran away because of the shooting.  It was also because I knew that they were also looking for me.
When you saw this kombi did you also see Mr Zikhali at that time?
The car was driven by him on that day, not by his driver.
Okay let's go back to the meeting that you had.
Let me just get a bit more of the picture, the background. You say you knew they were looking for you, why were they at that stage looking for you?
It was because I was an IFP member.
But there are millions of IFP members, they weren't looking for all the IFP members were they?

That is true.  I was a person well known in the location because I was vocal.  I used to approach people and tell them to stop what they were doing because they might find themselves in trouble in future.
Had you in the past attacked ANC people and that is why they were looking for you?
Before that, we became involved in skirmishes with the ANC people.  This happened during the day and it was after the ANC members had killed a lot of people.
When you say we I am talking about you. I am talking about you, did you yourself ...[intervention]
So you were known to them?
I knew that they were looking for me because there were other people who came from Pietermaritzburg on that day.  I was a known person then.
And so you think that on that day they may have been looking for you?
They did not say but I could see by their actions that they were looking for me.
They didn't tell you that we are looking for you, you just assumed that they were looking for you?

This scrap yard that was attacked is where a lot of IFP members were staying.  Their houses had been burnt at Nyanini and Mr Nyawuza had given them a shelter there.  He built shacks for them there.  This is the place then, that was always attacked by the ANC members.

But you couldn't have seen from their actions because when the shooting took place you were away from them. There was a shooting and you hid and you looked at it. So how could you see that they were looking for you?
I knew that they were looking for me because they had shot at me before.  This happened a day after I was chased by people with firearms.
The question was relating to you.  I am talking about you, how did you know that they were looking for you?
I knew because they shot at me before.
The shooting incidents that you mentioned between you and the ANC before this incident of the Ndlovu boy, where did that take place?
It happened in the location near Nsibande's house.
Is that in the IFP area or in the ANC area?
This was an IFP area.  There is also an ANC area in the location but is far.
And how did you become involved in those shootings?

I was involved with Mr Dlulane because I was a resident in the location.  One could not stay in the location if one was not an IFP member.  You had to move out of the area.  I stayed there because I am a boy from KwaZulu.  I had to look for myself.
What I am trying to get at, when this previous shootings took place who was doing the attacking?
ANC members were the ones who was doing the attacking.
And were you shooting at them in defence?
I was shot because I was defending myself.
Okay let's go back to the meeting regarding Mr Zikhali, was only Mr Zikhali discussed at that meeting?

Because of what Mr Zikhali did, we sat down and planned what we were going to do about him.  He could move in and out of both areas whilst we could not do that.  We realised that he was no longer involved with taxis as a taxis operator, but was now involved in politics.  We planned how we were going to attack him.  We were four when we planned, but there were only three of us who attacked him.  We then went to ...[intervention]
Just hold on a second.  Was it a decision that was made between the four of you or was there somebody taking the lead and in fact eventually giving an order?
The person who was taking decisions was not there when we went to do this.  After dropping us at a certain place, he drove to his house and waited there for us to phone him.  That is Mr Dlulane.
And when was it decided that this killing were to take place?

I think he was supposed to be killed in January 1993.  This, however, did not happen as we planned.  On this day then, we knew that his car had gone to the casino and we saw him being dropped somewhere by his driver.
When was this decision taken, when?
Yes when was the decision taken to have Mr Zikhali killed?
I cannot remember, but I remember that he was finally shot on a Sunday at about 8pm.
I see the date of death as indicated on the inquest document is the 21st of November of 1993, how long before the incident did you come to this decision?

It took a long time.  We started planning to kill him in 1992 and he was killed in 1993.  We could not get him at that time, and violence intensified in 1993 in the location and IFP members were killed without any reason, and I was also shot.  I do not know why they were being attacked.

Mr Myeza, - Sorry Mr Alberts, I am just trying to get an idea when he was killed in relation to the decision taken.  We have the dates, end of 1993 he was killed and you say in 1992 the decision was taken, can we try and approach this differently?
When you took the decision to kill Zikhali what did you do?
We were still deciding whether to kill him or talk to him so that he could stop what he was doing.  I then said to Mr Nyawuza ...[intervention]
No.  Sorry for interrupting.  Let's accept that you have now taken the decision, after the discussion he was to be killed, that decision was now taken, what did you then do to implement the decision?
There is nothing else we did other than to kill him.
You waited nearly a year to do that?
Yes, because we could not get hold of him.  We only managed to get him when we heard that he had a girlfriend staying in Ntuli's cottages in the location.
How did this girlfriend assist you in killing him?

Before we got hold of Mr Zikhali, our intention was to kill a Security Branch policeman.  When we went to his house, we were disturbed by a dog, and that policeman came out of his house with an R4 rifle.  We then ran away.  As we were running away, we saw Mr Zikhali accompanied by his girlfriend.  She was taking him to the bus stop where he was going to wait for his kombi to pick him up.  Vusi Myeza, without asking him anything, then shot him.
Can I just go back to my previous question, did the girlfriend actually assist you in killing or is it just the fact that you saw him with his girlfriend that assisted you?
No, his girlfriend did not assist us in anyway.  She left him at the bus stop and went back into her house.  We then got a chance to shoot him.
Was it just by chance that you now saw him somewhere where you could get to him?
Yes, because he was walking on foot and not in his car.
Okay tell us in detail what happened after you saw him going to the bus stop or rather to the taxi rank?

We followed him because we were on the road.  We then saw his girlfriend leaving him alone, and we then used the opportunity to attack him.  Myeza then shot him once in his chest.  We then left.  These boys ran to the scrap yard and I went to Mr Nyawuza's house.
Okay before we go to the details about where you went after the shooting, just give me some details about who was the person that did the shooting?
Were you also armed with a gun?
I did not shoot on that day.
So after he was shot what happened to him?

After he was shot, we ran away.  I went to Nyawuza's house while these other boys went to Regina Gcabashe.  I did not tell Mr Nyawuza of what we had done.  Regina Gcabashe then phoned Mr Nyawuza and informed him that the boys had told her that they had been attacked.  Mr Nyawuza and myself then got into his car to go and fetch these boys.  Mr Nyawuza handed his shot gun to me ...[intervention]
I think that this is becoming a little confusing.  Do you understand what is being said, are you getting a comprehensive picture of what he is saying?
Well now why are you allowing it?

Please I want you to understand that I would like this step by step.  You have told us that after the shooting your friend Myeza and his companion went to somebody else's house, they went to that scrap yard and they went to somebody else's house.  You went to Mr Dludlani and you reported to him that this man Zikhali had been killed, is that right?
Oh I thought you said: "I went and reported to Dludlani?
No, I did not tell him.  A short time after my arrival the phone rang.
Alright so you went to Mr Dludlani's house and what did you do there?
I kept quiet because there was females around.  We did not want them to know what we were doing.
Alright I don't want an explanation. What was the next thing that happened while you were at Mr Dludlani's house?

Regina Gcabashe who stay near the scrap yard then phoned and asked Mr Nyawuza to go and fetch the boys because they were being attacked.  Mr Nyawuza then took his shotgun and gave it to me, and we went there.  We found Vusi and Sbu Zuma and took them away.  As we were driving past the place where we had shot Mr Zikhali, we saw the police taking his body away.  We stopped our car to take a look, and Mr Nyawuza praised us for a job well done.
Could you just please slow down a little so we can follow it?  Would you tell us again, you went in the car to fetch Vuzi Myeza and Zuma?
And then you said something about the police taking the body?
Let's put it this way, where did you go to after you picked Vuzi Myeza and Zuma up?
We were on our way back to Mr Nyawuza's house.
We went to sit at Mr Nyawuza's house, just to see whom did the police suspect.  We realised that the police were not suspecting anyone of us.
My question was not all that, not what you suspected, my question was when you went to Nyawuza's place what happened if anything?
There were no police at Nyawuza's house.
Were the police in the vicinity of Nyawuza's place?
The police came and took Mr Zikhali's body.
They picked up the body of Zikhali?
There was no further shooting on that day in that area?
No, there was no further shooting.
Nothing further happened on that day?
Nothing happened until the following morning.
Right then that is the end of that chapter.

Sorry could I just get one follow up.
	You said there was a telephone call from Regina Gcabashe?
You went to fetch Vusi and Zuma, correct?
You went to Mr Nyawuza's place?
Is his place close to the scrap yard?
It is not that close to the scrap yard.
So did you not go and investigate the attack that Mrs Gcabashe phoned about?
We had gone to fetch the boys, not that we went to investigate the attack.  We knew what had happened there.
Were the boys at Mrs Gcabashe's place, Vusi and Zuma?
They went into the scrap yard but thereafter went to report to Regina Gcabashe.  She was also helping at the scrap yard.
Were they attacked at the scrap yard?
No, they were not being attacked.  This is the trick we use if something has happened in the location.
Nothing, we just went to fetch the boys.

Look here just understand, after the shooting incident when Zikhali was killed you received a telephone call whilst you were at this house from Mrs Gcabashe that there was an attack so you take your friends Vusi Myeza and the other friend of yours and you go there, was there an attack that the telephone call was all about?
There was no attack. So on that day there was just this one incident when Zikhali was killed?
There was no fighting in the location on that day.
Yes can we move on to the next incident?
Okay the next incident that you applied for amnesty for is that of the killing of a person by the name of Botha, is that the same person as Vusimuzi Mbokazi?
Botha was staying in the Ubambiswano School teacher's quarters.  He was just a school attending boy.
No, just the question is, is he the same person?  Is his full name Vusimuzi Muntukaziboni Mbukazi Botha, is that one person?
I do not know his surname.  I know him as Botha.
Is that the only name by which you know him?
Yes do carry on about talking about this killing of Botha.
Okay was a decision made to kill this Botha person?
Yes, we took a decision to kill Botha.
Who was present when this decision was taken?
It was Mr Dlulane, Vusi Myeza and myself.
And that is the same three persons that were involved in the meeting regarding Mr Zikhali, is that right?  That is the same people you mentioned when you spoke regarding Zikhali?
We were four when we decided to kill Mr Zikhali.
Yes but that is the same people, three of those people that were mentioned there are the three people you are mentioning now?
I cannot remember the date when Botha was killed, but it was a Saturday.
We were at Mr Dlulane's house.
And why was it decided that Botha was to be killed?

Mr Botha came to Mr Dlulane one day, after it was known that he was friendly to some ANC members.  At that time, IFP supporters were no longer allowed to attend classes at Ubambiswano School.  We were of the opinion that whenever Botha visited Mr Nyawuza's house in our absence, he would gather information and see whether Mr Nyawuza's house was guarded or not.  We then decided, the three of us, that we must do something to him.  We decided to shoot.
Okay was this suspicion that you had regarding him being, let's call it a spy, is that something you saw or that you heard or is it just a mere suspicion?
We were not just suspecting.  We knew that when he went to Mr Nyawuza's house when we were not there, he wanted to get some information from the boys who were also staying there.
Okay but can you tell me how do you know that?
He was also in the company of the ANC boys, and was not attending IFP meetings in the location.
If you say he was extracting information, how did he go about doing that?

He was asking the boys when we were going to a meeting and where.  The boys would then report to us.  Usually, after getting this information, our bus would then be ambushed on the way.  That is how we knew that he was passing information.
So what did he do when he gathered this information about where meetings were going to be held, what did he do?
He was telling the ANC people that information.
Are you trying to say that is why the bus or how the bus was attacked?
You also spoke about school kids not allowed to go to school, what was this Mr Botha's involvement in that?
He was involved in hitting the IFP youth members, especially the girls.  He was in the forefront.  He used to do this with other boys like Schoolboy and others.
What do you mean he was in the forefront, did he do something physically?
They used to carry firearms and use to stab schoolgirls on their buttocks.  They were doing this because these children were IFP members.
Let's just get this clear, I get a very confused picture from you.  You say he would stop children from going to school, how would he stop children from going to school?

The children were attending school at Ubambiswano High School.  When this violence started, they attacked these children and chased them away from the school.  These children could no longer attend school.
So are you saying that he, this Botha and others would go to school and attack the children and the teachers at school?

I had warned Botha several times that they should not attack the children because they were just attending school.  I told him that I did not like it.  His reply was that it is because we were "klovas" (derogatory word referring to IFP members).
Were you at the school when this happened?
Yes, I saw it with my own eyes.
So when you see this happening did you not go up to him and ask him why he is attacking the children?
So you were on talking terms with Mr Botha?
Yes, we were on talking terms with him.
What did he say when you asked him not to interfere with the children's schooling, what did he say?
He used to tell me that there was nothing I could do and that I was speaking on their behalf because we were all IFP members.
Mr Myeza did he come out clear that he was an ANC member?
Yes.  He told me that he was an ANC member and nobody would change him.
So when initially you said it was known that he was an ANC sympathizer, that could not be correct then?
I would not know whether he had an ANC membership card, but the were wearing ANC T-shirts.

When he went and prevented children at school, he and his friends prevented children from studying at school you saw it, every other Inkatha member in that area, IFP member in the area would see him doing this?
Yes, other people saw them doing it.
And they did nothing about it?
The community could do nothing because it was afraid of the ANC children.
Schoolboy, their secretary would be present with other boys.
The question if I understood it correctly was: did the community, the Inkatha community in the location do nothing when Botha attacked the children?
Who came with Botha to tell these children not to go to school, was he on his own?
Schoolboy, their secretary would be present with other boys.
Were they from the locatio, the other youths?
Yes, they were from the location.

This is the youths with Botha who were ...(inaudible) - just leave that till I have finished. Please leave the microphone till I have finished the question because you won't be able to hear me if you switch on yours.  The people who stopped the children from going to school, they were people that Botha was part of, were the others some of the school children or were they coming from outside the location?
Some of them were also attending school there, and were staying in the location.  Some of them had fled the location and were staying in Nyanini.
So these were people who came in from the Njanini, they weren't people from your area?
This is one area under the one iNgoso.  It was a location and a missionary that is rural.
These people when they came to the school did they just talk to the children or what did they do to chase children out of the school?
They would go to this school when children are on the break.  The car would then drop them there and when the children go to the shops to buy, they would then approach them and attack them.
Okay and at this meeting you later held what was the decision that you came to?

We decided that he should be shot dead because he did not want peace in the location.  Mr Nyawuza then took out the rounds from ammunition from the firearm we got from another policeman stationed at Eshowe town.  He gave those rounds to Vusi Myeza.  I am the one who knew where this boy was staying and I then led them there.
Just before we go onto that.  Was that a decision that was taken unanimously by the three of you or was there an order given?
We were just followers of the IFP.  The person in charge was Mr Dlulane.
How long after this incident was Botha eventually murdered?
We did not take a long time, we planned during the day and he was shot that evening.
Okay you said you were to point out the house of Botha, when you left the meeting ...[intervention]
Yes, I went to point where he was staying.
What happened after you left the meeting?

When we arrived there, we got into the house.  I was with Vusi Myeza.  We talked to him and asked him to show us the room that was to be let.  He did not know the person who was with me.  He then showed us that room that was unoccupied.  He had a candle and Vusi then shot him twice.

Vusi fired twice.  I think he shot him on the head because Vusi was following him as he was going to show him this room.  We thereafter ran to Mr Nyawuza's house.  We reported this matter to him and he confirmed that he had heard a gunshot.
After a shot was fired what did you then do?
Nothing happened after we shot him.  What I remember is that his body was only found by the police the following day.
And did you report to your superiors that the shooting was in fact done?
Yes, we told Mr Nyawuza that we had shot him.
In point of time when was this killing, do you know?
Mr Chairman I see on the inquest it looks like 21/11 or 21/10/93 the person Mbukazi as far as I can gather.
Where does that appear Mr Brink?
Page 47 of the papers about, after identification the deceased: adult male 27 years there is: 21/11/93.
If that is in fact the person named Botha. As far as we can gather that is the inquest ...[intervention]
So if that is correct then this happened the day after Zikhali was killed?
As far as I can remember Botha is the first person to be killed.
Did the two incidents happen within a day of each other?
I cannot say, but I think we killed Botha first, then Zikhali.

I see the date given on the two inquest documents are both 21/11/93.
	What time of the day was Botha killed?
Botha was killed at about 8:30 pm.
Was he alone at his home?
How old was this person Botha?
Botha was a little older than me.
Can we proceed to the next incident?  The next incident would be the killing of ...(intervention)
Sorry just before you proceed, just this one last question.  Can you remember that Botha and Zikhali, that you killed them on the same day?
Can you remember whether you killed them within a week or was it a year apart, what does your memory tell you?
It was the same year, either 1992/93.
Are you sure that it wasn't on the same day?
I am sure it was not on the same day.
You see the court papers record that they were both shot, they give you the date of death as being the 21st of November 1993.
That is not true, they were not killed on the same day.
Well since you don't have a recollection of whether they were killed within the same month or within the same year your evidence is not very helpful.
It was the same year but not the same day.  It could be the same month but definitely not the same day.

Very well there is nothing we can do about that.
	Yes will you move on?

The third incident that you are asking for amnesty is Bonginkosi Khanyile. Can you tell us who
Bonginkosi Khanyile was?
I was told that Bonginkosi Khanyile was from Vuma area.  I did not know him.  He was accidentally killed.  We were from the conference at Ensingweni.
Who was this Mr Kanyele, was he an ANC member at the ...(intervention)

No just, just don't put it like that. He says it was done by mistake. Let's just get some more details about where this was done, how it was done?
